text: With regard to endothelial damage, infection by human herpes simplex virusbelonging to the same subfamily that BHV-1 [44] has been shown to cause endothelial injury, favoring the exposure of subendothelial tissue and the release of procoagulant mediators [45, 46] . Here, however, neither histopathological nor ultrastructural examination disclosed any morphological evidence of endothelial damage in either of the inoculated groups.
